exceptions.exn: Found no subterm matching "length Q" in H.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat
f: nat -> nat -> mm_instr (pos n) -> mm_instr (pos (S n))
g: nat -> nat -> list (mm_instr (pos n)) -> list (mm_instr (pos (S n)))
g_app: forall (k i : nat) P Q, g k i (P ++ Q) = g k i P ++ g k (length P + i) Q
g_app_inv: forall (k i : nat) P (l r : list (mm_instr (pos (S n)))), g k i P = l ++ r -> exists L R : list (mm_instr (pos n)), P = L ++ R /\ l = g k i L /\ r = g k (length l + i) R
length_g: forall (l i : nat) P, length (g l i P) = length P
g_subcode: forall (k i : nat) P (j : nat) (ρ : mm_instr (pos n)), (j, ρ :: nil) <sc (i, P) -> (j, f k j ρ :: nil) <sc (i, g k i P)
subcode_g: forall (k i : nat) P (j : nat) (ρ : mm_instr (pos (S n))), (j, ρ :: nil) <sc (i, g k i P) -> exists ρ' : mm_instr (pos n), (j, ρ' :: nil) <sc (i, P) /\ ρ = f k j ρ'
g_loops: forall (k i : nat) P, 1 <= i -> i + length P <= k -> mm_no_self_loops (i, g k i P)
P: list (mm_instr (pos n))
R: list (mm_instr (pos (S n)))
sc_R_1: (1 + lP, DECₐ pos0 0 :: nil) <sc (1 + lP, R)
sc_R_2: (2 + lP, DECₐ pos0 (1 + (2 + lP)) :: DECₐ pos0 (2 + lP) :: nil) <sc (1 + lP, R)
R_sc: forall (i : nat) (rho : mm_instr (pos (S n))), (i, rho :: nil) <sc (1 + lP, R) -> i = 1 + lP /\ rho = DECₐ pos0 0 \/ i = 2 + lP /\ rho = DECₐ pos0 (3 + lP) \/ i = 3 + lP /\ rho = DECₐ pos0 (2 + lP)
R_no_self_loops: mm_no_self_loops (1 + lP, R)
Q: list (mm_instr (pos (S n)))
Q_no_self_loops: mm_no_self_loops (1, Q)
sc_Q_1: forall (j : nat) (ρ : mm_instr (pos n)), (j, ρ :: nil) <sc (1, P) -> (j, f (1 + lP) j ρ :: nil) <sc (1, Q)
sc_Q_2: (1 + lP, DECₐ pos0 0 :: DECₐ pos0 (3 + lP) :: DECₐ pos0 (2 + lP) :: nil) <sc (1, Q)
sc_Q_3: (2 + lP, DECₐ pos0 (3 + lP) :: DECₐ pos0 (2 + lP) :: nil) <sc (1, Q)
Q_sc: forall (j : nat) (ρ : mm_instr (pos (S n))), (j, ρ :: nil) <sc (1, Q) -> (exists ρ' : mm_instr (pos n), (j, ρ' :: nil) <sc (1, P) /\ ρ = f (1 + lP) j ρ') \/ j = 1 + lP /\ ρ = DECₐ pos0 0 \/ j = 2 + lP /\ ρ = DECₐ pos0 (3 + lP) \/ j = 3 + lP /\ ρ = DECₐ pos0 (2 + lP)
Q_length: length Q = lP + 3
i: nat
x: pos (S n)
j: nat

Goal:
(i, DECₐ x j :: nil) <sc (1, Q) -> j < 1 + length Q

```coq
intros.
pose proof Q_length as Hq.
rewrite Hq in H. simpl in H.
pose proof sc_Q_1 as Hsc1.
specialize (Hsc1 j (DECₐ x j) H).
destruct Hsc1 as [rho [Hsc1' Heq]].
destruct rho.
- lia.
- inversion Hsc1'.
  + subst. lia.
  + subst. lia.
Qed.```

original: intros. pose proof Q_length as Hq. rewrite Hq in H. simpl in H. pose proof sc_Q_1 as Hsc1. specialize (Hsc1 j (DECₐ x j) H). destruct Hsc1 as [rho [Hsc1' Heq]]. destruct rho. - lia. - inversion Hsc1'. + subst. lia. + subst. lia.
